private_information: My peg initially holds disks (top->bottom): A, B, C, D, E, F where A is smallest and F is largest
left_peg_agent.goal: Report my local state so the orchestrator can generate a global plan to move all disks to the right peg legally.

middle_peg_agent.goal: Report my local state so the orchestrator can generate a global plan to move all disks to the right peg legally.

right_peg_agent.goal: Report my local state so the orchestrator can generate a global plan to move all disks to the right peg legally.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the peg states and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem compatible with the Fast Downwards solver that achieves the final configuration: right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 6 disks labeled A (smallest), B, C, D, E, F (largest).
Only one disk may be moved at a time.
A larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg is empty; middle peg is empty; right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F.

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the left peg. Provide a concise structured description of your local state: list your disks from top to bottom and confirm peg identity. Do not produce PDDL or attempt global planning.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->left_peg_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->left_peg_agent->goal}. Provide a short structured state report that the orchestrator can consume, for example: peg:left disks:[A,B,C,D,E,F].

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the middle peg. Provide a concise structured description of your local state: list your disks from top to bottom and confirm peg identity. Do not produce PDDL or attempt global planning.
report.prompt: Your name is middle_peg_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->middle_peg_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->middle_peg_agent->goal}. Provide a short structured state report that the orchestrator can consume, for example: peg:middle disks:[].

report.system_prompt: You are the agent responsible for the right peg. Provide a concise structured description of your local state: list your disks from top to bottom and confirm peg identity. Do not produce PDDL or attempt global planning.
report.prompt: Your name is right_peg_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->right_peg_agent->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->right_peg_agent->goal}. Provide a short structured state report that the orchestrator can consume, for example: peg:right disks:[].

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling for the Fast Downwards (FD) planner. Use the peg state reports to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the Tower of Hanoi with three pegs and six disks. The domain must enforce single-disk moves and the rule forbidding larger disks on smaller ones. The produced PDDL must be compatible with the Fast Downwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. You will receive the three peg state reports: {state_left}, {state_middle}, {state_right}. Integrate these local states with the public information {environment->public_information} to produce a single coherent planning model. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the goal: right peg has (top->bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F and other pegs are empty. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with Fast Downwards and that moves transfer a single disk between pegs while preserving size ordering. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
